At that time, Brahma ViÅ›eá¹£acinti addressed the Buddha, saying: World-Honored One! How do bodhisattvas
surpass worldly dharmas while manifesting in worldly dharmas, and yet not be tainted by those worldly dharmas?
How do they truly understand worldly dharmas while following worldly dharmas, and yet not be tainted by worldly dharmas?
How do they teach and transform sentient beings to leave the world, attain the equality of worldly dharmas, and practice in the world without destroying worldly dharmas?
At that time, the World-Honored One answered Brahma with a verse, saying:
I say the aggregates are the world, the world's basis.
Not relying on the five aggregates, one attains liberation from worldly dharmas.
Bodhisattvas have wisdom, knowing the true nature of the world.
Although they accord with the five aggregates, they are not tainted by them.
Gain and loss, praise and blame, slander and fame, suffering and happiness,
Such eight dharmas always drag the world.
The bodhisattvas of great wisdom, know the worldly dharmas as they really are,
Seeing the world's decaying characteristics, abide in them without moving,
When gaining benefits, their minds are not elevated, when losing benefits, their minds do not lower,
Their minds are firm and unmoving, not following worldly dharmas.
Gain and loss, slander and fame, praise and blame, suffering and happiness,
Regarding these eight worldly dharmas, their minds are always impartial,
Knowing the world is false, arising from two inverted views,
The wise bodhisattvas do not follow the worldly path.
All the paths in the world, the bodhisattvas fully understand,
Therefore, they are able to deliver sentient beings from suffering in the world.
Although they practice in the world, they are unstained like a lotus flower,
They do not destroy worldly dharmas, because they penetrate the nature of dharmas.
Worldly beings engage in the world, but do not know the world;
Bodhisattvas engage in the world, clearly understanding the characteristics of the world.
The world has the characteristics of empty space, and empty space also has no characteristics;
Bodhisattvas know this thus, and are not defiled by the world.
As they know the world, they expound according to their knowledge;
Knowing the nature of the world, they do not destroy the world.
The five aggregates have no intrinsic nature, which is precisely the nature of the world;
If people do not know this, they always abide in the world.
If one sees and knows the five aggregates, without arising and also without ceasing,
This person engages in the world, but does not rely on the world.
Foolish people do not know the Dharma, and give rise to disputes in the world,
This is real and this is unreal, abiding in these two characteristics.
I always do not engage in disputes with the world,
Because I have already fully understood the true nature of the world.
The Dharma taught by the Buddhas is all free from disputes,
Because it knows the world to be of equal nature, neither real nor false.
If the Buddha Dharma were definite, with reality and falsehood,
Then it would be the same as the non-Buddhist teachings, with attachment.
But now in the Buddha Dharma, there is neither reality nor falsehood,
Therefore I always say that the supramundane Dharma is non-dual.
If a person knows the true nature of the world in this way,
They will not grasp this evil view, whether it is real or false.
Knowing the world in this way, pure like space,
This person of great renown illuminates the world like the sun.
If a person sees the world as I see it,
Such people will be able to see the buddhas of the ten directions.
All dharmas arise from conditions and have no fixed nature of their own.
If one understands this principle of dependent origination, one will penetrate the true nature of dharmas.
If one knows the true nature of dharmas, one will know the characteristics of emptiness.
If one can know the characteristics of emptiness, one will see the guide.
If there are people who can hear this kind of worldly characteristic,
Although they practice in the world, they do not dwell in the world.
People who rely on various views cannot reach this state.
How does one practice in the world without relying on the world?
If after the Buddha's nirvana, there are those who delight in this acceptance,
The Buddha will always manifest in the world for such people.
If people understand this, they will protect my Dharma,
And also make offerings to me, and be guides in the world.
If one can understand the nature of the world in an instant,
Then one will never be taken advantage of by evil mÄras.
If one can penetrate this meaning, then one has great wisdom,
Such a person is greatly wealthy, a donor of the wealth of the Dharma.
If one knows the world to be like this, then one is also fully observing precepts,
Their power of patience is courageous and strong, and they progress with great vigor.
They are fully endowed with various meditative absorptions and attain great spiritual powers,
With wisdom they accurately understand all worldly paths.
If one can practice in this way, then they will accomplish samÄdhi,
Delighting in solitary places, then they will give rise to prajÃ±Ä.
Wherever this Dharma is heard, there the Buddha is not in vain,
Thus for bodhisattvas, it is not long before they sit at the site of enlightenment.
If there is profound understanding and insight into the nature of the world like this,
Then one will be able to subdue the mÄras and quickly attain the unsurpassed path.
The TathÄgata again said to the holy MahÄbrahmÄ ViÅ›iá¹£á¹­acintin:
BrahmÄ!

BrahmÄ!

As for the world, I say the five aggregates are called the world. Attachment to the five aggregates is called the arising of the world. The exhaustion of the five aggregates is called the cessation of the world. Observing the five aggregates and not seeing two dharmas is called the path to the cessation of the world.
Furthermore, BrahmÄ!

As for the five aggregates, the five aggregates are merely words. Grasping at words and wrong views within them is called the world. Not abandoning this view is called the arising of the world. The intrinsic nature of this view is called the cessation of the world. Following any path without grasping at this view is called the path to the cessation of the world.
BrahmÄ!

My intention is in this, and therefore I now, within this body of one zhang, speak of the suffering of the world, the accumulation of the world, the cessation of the world, and the path to the cessation of the world.
At that time, Brahma, the Lord of the SahÄ World, addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
As the Buddha has said, the four noble truths, I do not yet know which are the true noble truths.
The Buddha said:
Brahma!
What is called the truth of suffering is not a true noble truth.
Brahma!
What is called the truth of the accumulation of suffering is not a true noble truth.
Brahma!
What is called the truth of the cessation of suffering is not a true noble truth.
Brahma!
What is called the truth of the path to the cessation of suffering is not a true noble truth.
Brahma!
If that suffering were a true noble truth, then all cows, horses, and other animals would have a true truth.
Why is it so?
Because they all experience various kinds of suffering.
For this reason, suffering is not a true truth.
Brahma Heaven!
If that which is accumulated is the truth of the noble ones, then the six destinies of beings should have a real truth.
Why is this?
Because that which is accumulated gives rise to the various destinies.
For this reason, that which is accumulated is not a real truth.
Brahma Heaven!
If that which ceases is the truth of the noble ones, then those in the world who fall into the view of annihilation should have a real truth.
Why is this?
Because they speak of the cessation of dharmas as nirvana. For this reason, that which ceases is not a real truth.
Brahma Heaven!
If that which is the path is the truth of the noble ones, then those who rely on all conditioned paths should have a real truth.
Why is this?
Because they rely on conditioned dharmas to seek to leave conditioned dharmas.
For this reason, that which is the path is not a real truth.
Brahma Heaven!
Therefore, you should know that the truth of suffering, the truth of accumulation, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path are not real truths of the noble ones.
Brahma Heaven!
The truth of the noble ones' reality is knowing that suffering has no arising; this is called the noble truth of suffering.
Knowing that the origin [of suffering] has no combination, this is called the noble truth of the origin [of suffering].
Within the Dharma of ultimate cessation, knowing no arising and no cessation, this is called the noble truth of cessation.
Equality with all dharmas, attaining the path through the non-dual Dharma, this is called the noble truth of the path.
Brahma Heaven!
The truth of the noble ones' reality is neither false speech nor true speech.
Brahma Heaven!
What is false speech?

Namely, attachment to self, attachment to sentient beings, attachment to life, attachment to a great man, attachment to a person, attachment to the view of permanence, attachment to the view of annihilation, attachment to the view of existence, attachment to the view of separation from existence, attachment to the view of arising, attachment to the view of cessation, attachment to the view of birth and death, attachment to the view of nirvana.
Brahma Heaven!
This is called false speech.
Brahma Heaven!
If one is not attached to such views, does not touch such views, and does not grasp such views, this is called true speech.
Brahma Heaven!
If a practitioner says, 'I know suffering,' this is called a lie.ğŸ”½If a practitioner says, 'I cut off the cause of suffering,' this is called a lie.
If a practitioner says, 'I realize cessation,' this is called a lie.
If a practitioner says, 'I cultivate the path,' this is called a lie.
Why is it so?
Because it does not accord with the Buddha's permitted mindfulness, it is called a lie.
Brahma Heaven!
What is it to accord with the Buddha's permitted mindfulness?
It means not recollecting any dharmas.
If one does not recollect any dharmas, this is called according with the Buddha's permitted mindfulness.
If a practitioner abides in this mindfulness, then he does not abide in any characteristics;
if he does not abide in any characteristics, then he abides in reality;
if he abides in reality, this is called non-abiding mind;
if the mind does not abide, this person is called neither a speaker of truth nor a speaker of falsehood.
Brahma Heaven!
Therefore, you should know that if it is neither true speech nor false speech, it is called the true holy truth of the sages.
Brahma Heaven!

The so-called true truth is true from ancient times to the present. Whether the Buddha appears in the world or not, the nature of dharmas is always thus, the dharma realm is always thus, and the world and nirvana are also thus and always thus. Therefore, it is called the true holy truth.
Why is it so?
It is not called the holy truth by leaving behind birth and death, nor is it called the holy truth by causing one to grasp nirvana.
Brahma Heaven!
If a person realizes such four truths, he is called a speaker of true words.
Brahma Heaven!

In the future, there will be bhiká¹£us who do not cultivate the body, do not cultivate precepts, do not cultivate the mind, and do not cultivate wisdom. These people will say that the characteristic of arising is the truth of suffering, the convergence of various conditions is the truth of accumulation, the cessation of dharmas is the truth of cessation, and the non-dual dharma seeking characteristics is the truth of the path.

I say that such foolish people are followers of non-Buddhist paths who will fall into evil destinies. I am not their teacher, and they are not my Å›rÄvaka disciples. Because such people follow non-Buddhist paths and destroy the Dharma, they say there is truth.

Just observe when I was sitting at the site of enlightenment, I did not attain a single dharma that was real or false. If the Buddha does not attain the Dharma, how could there be any speech, discussion, or teaching in the assembly about this Dharma?
BrahmÄ said:
No, World-Honored One!
The Buddha said:
BrahmÄ!
Because all dharmas are unattainable and all dharmas are devoid of intrinsic nature, my enlightenment is characterized by the absence of craving.
At that time, the BrahmÄ god Supreme Thought said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
If the TathÄgata does not attain any dharmas, for what meaning do you say that when the TathÄgata sits at the site of enlightenment, he is called a Buddha?
What Dharma does one realize, that one is called a TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One?
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!
What do you think?
Are the dharmas I speak of, whether conditioned or unconditioned,
real dharmas?
Or are they false dharmas?
Brahma Heaven said:
World-Honored One!

Sugata!
These dharmas are false and not real.
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!
What do you think?
If a dharma is false and not real, is that dharma existent?
Or is it nonexistent?
Brahma Heaven said:
World-Honored One!
If a dharma is false, that dharma should not be said to exist, nor should it be said to not exist.
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!
What do you think?
If a dharma is neither existent nor nonexistent, can that dharma be attained?
Brahma Heaven said:
World-Honored One!
If a dharma does not exist, that dharma cannot be said to exist or not exist.
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!
If a dharma is neither existent nor non-existent, how can that dharma be realized?
Brahma Heaven said:
World-Honored One!
That dharma is not realized.
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!

When the Tathagata sat at the site of enlightenment, he only knew that the afflictions and defilements that arise from false inverted [views] are ultimately not produced. It is because of having nothing to attain that he attained, and because of having nothing to know that he knew.
Why is it so?
Brahma Heaven!

The Dharma I have attained cannot be seen, heard, cognized, known, remembered, grasped, attached to, spoken of, or disputed. It transcends all realms, is beyond words and speech, without practice, not sought, without letters, without the path of language, not the realm of cognition, and is not spoken by language.
Brahma Heaven!
That Dharma is like this, just like empty space. Do you wish to attain realization within such a Dharma?

The Buddhas, the Tathagatas, are extremely rare. They accomplish inconceivable and unprecedented dharmas. They deeply enter great kindness and great compassion, attain such a dharma of quiescent extinction, and teach it to others using written language and speech.
World-Honored One!
If there are sentient beings who can hear this Dharma and have faith and understanding, know that such people do not come from small merits.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Why is it so?

Why is it so?
Because the world cannot believe in such a Dharma.
The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!
How is it that this Dharma is difficult for all worlds to believe in?
Brahma Heaven said:
World-Honored One!
The world is attached to the truth, but this Dharma is not like this. This Dharma is neither real nor false;
The world is attached to the Dharma, but this Dharma has no Dharma and no non-Dharma;

Just as it is difficult to believe that fire can arise from water and water can arise from fire, likewise, it is also difficult to believe that within afflictions there is enlightenment and within enlightenment there are afflictions.

If good men and good women are able to believe and understand such Dharma meanings, one should know that such people are liberated from all views and have made offerings to the buddhas.

The Buddha said:
Brahma Heaven!

The TathÄgata speaks of past dharmas, future dharmas, present dharmas, defiled dharmas, pure dharmas, good dharmas, bad dharmas, worldly dharmas, supramundane dharmas, contaminated dharmas, uncontaminated dharmas, sinful dharmas, sinless dharmas, conditioned dharmas, unconditioned dharmas, dharmas of self, sentient beings, persons, and human beings, dharmas of attainment and realization, dharmas of birth and death, and dharmas of nirvÄá¹‡a.

You should know that all these verbal expressions are like speaking of magical illusions, because they are without any fixed reality;
They are like speaking of dreams, because they are false appearances;
They are like echoes, because they come from empty sounds;
